intro: Piper cernuum var. araguense, commonly known as the Araguá pepper, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into elongated, fleshy berries. Its aromatic leaves and fruits are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. The species is adapted to humid, shaded environments and thrives in tropical rainforests.
